attributes.text:
The Accordion is a group of vertically stacked panels (here called pages), each with a header. By default, only one page is visible while the others are collapsed. Clicking or tapping a collapsed page’s header will expand it while collapsing the previously expanded page.

Markup

The Accordion contains an unordered list element (ul), which will be created if not already present. Headers and pages are list items (li). Each header must contain a button with an accordionPage data attribute where the value is a CSS selector string identifying the corresponding page. Headers and pages will not be created automatically. They can be predefined in the DOM before the q().accordion() factory method is called, or added programmatically.

CSS Classes

Class Name Applied to Description
qx-accordion Container element Identifies the Accordion widget
qx-accordion-button Page header (li) Identifies and styles the page headers
qx-accordion-button-active Page header (li) Identifies and styles the header of the currently expanded page. Applied in addition to qx-accordion-button
qx-accordion-page Page (li) Identifies and styles the pages
